answers: Ans. (a) (i) Pole – Centre of the reflecting surface of the mirror. (ii) Centre of curvature – The centre of the hollow sphere of which the reflecting surface of mirror is a part. (iv) Principal focus – Incident rays parallel to principal axis, after reflection, either converge to or appear to diverge from a fixed point on the principal axis called principal focus of the spherical mirror.
